Question 175) A person buys weekly, in the same store, always the same amount as a product that costs $ 10.00 a unit. As you already know how much you should spend, it always takes $ 6.00 more than the amount required to buy such a quantity, for any extra expenses. However, one day, when he arrived at the store, he was informed that the price of that product had increased 20%. Due to this readjustment, he concluded that the money taken was the exact amount to buy two units less compared to the amount usually purchased.
The amount that this person took weekly to make the purchase was
A) R $ 166.00.
B) R $ 156.00.
C) R $ 84.00.
D) R $ 46.00.
E) R $ 24.00.
